definitions: semi-formal jacket typically worn separately from matching trousers as part of smart casual attire
person or thing that marks a trail or creates a distinctive path
examples: She wore a navy blazer over her white shirt for the interview
The school uniform includes a dark green blazer with the school crest
The team captain was a blazer who set new standards for excellence
Early explorers were blazers marking routes through uncharted territories

definitions: state of burning fiercely with bright flames and intense heat
condition of being extremely hot, bright, or emotionally intense
examples: The blazing fire consumed the entire forest within hours
Firefighters battled the blazing building throughout the night
They hiked through the desert under the blazing midday sun
Her blazing anger was evident in her fierce expression

definitions: coat of arms or heraldic shield displaying family or organizational symbols and colors
conspicuous display or proclamation of information meant to be widely known
examples: The family blazon featured a golden lion on a blue field
Medieval knights wore their blazon proudly on shields and banners
The newspaper blazon announced the company's merger in bold headlines
Their achievements were a blazon of success for the entire community

definitions: chemical solution used to whiten fabrics or remove color and stains
process of becoming lighter in color through exposure to sun or chemicals
examples: Add a cup of bleach to the white laundry load
The janitor used bleach to disinfect the bathroom surfaces
Years of sun exposure caused the bleach of her hair
The desert sun created a natural bleach effect on the bones

definitions: tiered bench seating typically found in sports venues or outdoor arenas
person or substance that bleaches or whitens materials
examples: The fans filled every row of the bleachers during the championship game
We found seats in the bleachers behind third base
The industrial bleacher removed all color from the fabric samples
Traditional bleachers used sunlight to whiten linens naturally

definitions: flow of blood from damaged blood vessels or wounds
spreading of color or dye beyond intended boundaries in fabric or print
examples: The nurse applied pressure to stop the bleeding from the cut
Internal bleeding can be a serious medical emergency requiring immediate attention
The bleeding of red ink ruined the entire document
Wash new jeans separately to prevent color bleeding onto other clothes

definitions: short high-pitched electronic sound produced by machines or devices
sound used to censor offensive language in broadcast media
examples: The heart monitor made a steady bleep with each heartbeat
The microwave gives three bleeps when the food is ready
The comedy show had several bleeps covering the comedian's profanity
Radio stations use a bleep to mask inappropriate words

definitions: small mark or flaw on skin surface that mars its appearance
imperfection that damages the quality or reputation of something
examples: The dermatologist treated the blemish on her cheek with medication
Teenagers often struggle with facial blemishes during puberty
The scandal was a blemish on the politician's previously clean record
One small blemish in the crystal reduced its value significantly

definitions: electric kitchen device with rotating blades for mixing and liquefying food
person who combines or mixes different elements to create something new
examples: She used the blender to make a fresh fruit smoothie
The powerful blender can crush ice and frozen fruits easily
The artist was a talented blender of traditional and modern styles
As a cultural blender, she brought diverse communities together

definitions: process of combining different substances or elements into a uniform mixture
seamless integration of different elements creating a harmonious whole
examples: The blending of spices creates the unique flavor of curry
Careful blending of colors produced the perfect shade of paint
The blending of cultures enriched the neighborhood's character
Musical blending of jazz and classical created a new genre

definitions: disease that causes plants to wither and die rapidly
something that spoils or damages the quality of an area or situation
examples: Potato blight destroyed the entire crop causing widespread famine
The gardener sprayed fungicide to prevent tomato blight
Urban blight turned once-thriving neighborhoods into abandoned areas
Corruption was a blight on the city's political system

definitions: non-rigid airship filled with gas used for observation or advertising
aerial camera platform used for filming sports events from above
examples: The advertising blimp floated over the stadium during the game
Tourist blimps offer scenic flights over the city skyline
The television blimp captured aerial footage of the race
Camera operators in the blimp provided unique overhead shots

definitions: leather or plastic eye covering that restricts a horse's peripheral vision
something that prevents someone from seeing or understanding the full situation
examples: The racehorse wore blinders to maintain focus on the track ahead
Carriage horses in the city often wear blinders to reduce distractions
His political loyalty acted as a blinder to the party's faults
Personal bias can be a blinder preventing objective judgment

definitions: piece of cloth tied over eyes to prevent seeing
method of deliberately hiding information or keeping someone uninformed
examples: The children wore blindfolds during the party game
The kidnapper used a blindfold to prevent victim identification
Operating without data is like working with a blindfold
The blindfold of ignorance kept citizens unaware of corruption

definitions: expensive flashy jewelry and accessories worn to display wealth
culture or style characterized by conspicuous displays of luxury
examples: The rapper wore heavy gold chains and diamond bling
Her bling caught everyone's attention at the party
The mansion was pure bling with gold fixtures everywhere
Corporate bling included luxury cars and private jets

definitions: rapid closing and opening of eyelids as natural reflex
very short period of time or fleeting moment
examples: The bright light made her blink several times involuntarily
Doctors test reflexes by checking the blink response
The opportunity disappeared in the blink of an eye
Technology changes so fast that innovations become obsolete in a blink

definitions: repeated closing and opening of eyelids either voluntarily or involuntarily
intermittent flashing of lights on electronic devices or signals
examples: Excessive blinking can indicate eye strain or fatigue
The doctor noticed unusual blinking patterns during the examination
The blinking cursor on the screen awaited user input
Emergency vehicles use blinking lights to alert other drivers

definitions: small spot of light on radar or electronic display screen
temporary minor problem or irregularity in otherwise smooth operation
examples: Air traffic controllers monitored each blip on the radar screen
The submarine appeared as a faint blip on sonar
The stock market blip lasted only a few hours
Technical blips occasionally interrupt the broadcast signal

definitions: fluid-filled bubble on skin caused by friction, burning, or disease
raised bubble or defect on painted or manufactured surfaces
examples: New shoes gave her painful blisters on both heels
The burn created a large blister that required medical attention
Heat caused paint blisters to form on the car hood
Quality control rejected products with surface blisters

definitions: extreme heat sufficient to cause blisters or severe discomfort
severely critical or harsh in nature, especially regarding verbal attacks
examples: The blistering desert heat made travel dangerous during midday
Workers endured blistering temperatures inside the factory
The reviewer delivered a blistering critique of the performance
Her blistering response silenced all opposition

definitions: sudden overwhelming attack using concentrated military force
intensive campaign or effort to achieve something quickly
examples: The football team's defensive blitz caught the quarterback off guard
The aerial blitz destroyed the enemy's supply lines
The company launched a marketing blitz for the new product
Students faced a blitz of exams during finals week

definitions: military tactic using sudden massive force combining air and ground attacks for rapid victory
any swift overwhelming attack designed to defeat opposition before they can respond
examples: The blitzkrieg strategy revolutionized modern warfare tactics
Historical studies examine the effectiveness of blitzkrieg in World War Two
The corporate blitzkrieg of acquisitions dominated the market
Their legal team launched a blitzkrieg of motions and filings

definitions: severe snowstorm with high winds and low visibility lasting several hours
overwhelming number or amount of things happening at once
examples: The blizzard trapped residents in their homes for three days
Weather forecasters warned of an approaching blizzard from the north
A blizzard of paperwork awaited the new employee
The celebrity faced a blizzard of criticism on social media

definitions: drop or mass of thick liquid or soft substance without definite shape
binary large object storing data in database systems
examples: A blob of paint dripped onto the clean floor
The jellyfish looked like a transparent blob in the water
The database stores images as blob data types
Programmers optimize blob storage for better performance

definitions: group of countries or political parties with shared interests forming an alliance
any group acting together as a unified force for common purpose
examples: The trading bloc negotiated favorable terms for member nations
Eastern European countries formed a defensive bloc
The voting bloc influenced the election outcome significantly
Union members acted as a bloc during contract negotiations

definitions: military operation preventing goods or people from entering or leaving an area
any barrier that prevents movement or access to something
examples: Naval forces maintained a blockade of the enemy port
The blockade prevented food supplies from reaching the city
Protesters formed a human blockade outside the building
Economic blockades can be as effective as military ones

definitions: something that blocks a passage or tube preventing normal flow
condition where progress or movement is prevented by obstacles
examples: The plumber cleared the blockage in the kitchen drain
Arterial blockage can lead to serious heart problems
Traffic blockage on the highway caused major delays
Bureaucratic blockages slowed the approval process

definitions: highly successful movie, book, or show generating massive revenue and popularity
large bomb capable of destroying entire city blocks
examples: The summer blockbuster broke all box office records
Publishers compete to find the next blockbuster novel
World War Two blockbusters could level entire neighborhoods
The military developed blockbusters for strategic bombing

definitions: substance or device that prevents or inhibits a specific action or process
player whose role is to obstruct opponents in sports
examples: The doctor prescribed beta blockers for high blood pressure
Ad blockers prevent unwanted advertisements from displaying
The offensive blocker protected the quarterback from tackles
Volleyball blockers jump at the net to deflect spikes

definitions: small fort or reinforced building with openings for defensive firing
concrete structure providing protection from explosions or attacks
examples: Colonial settlers built blockhouses for protection against raids
The military blockhouse guarded the strategic mountain pass
Launch control operates from an underground blockhouse
Historic blockhouses now serve as tourist attractions

definitions: action of preventing movement or progress by creating obstacles
planned movement and positioning of actors on stage during performance
examples: Illegal parking resulted in blocking the emergency exit
The new law focuses on blocking cybercrime activities
The director spent hours perfecting the scene's blocking
Good blocking enhances the visual storytelling of plays

definitions: person who regularly writes and publishes content on a blog website
digital content creator sharing opinions, experiences, or expertise online
examples: The food blogger reviewed restaurants across the city
Many bloggers monetize their sites through advertising
Fashion bloggers influence trends with their style posts
The travel blogger documented adventures in forty countries

definitions: informal British term for a man or fellow
ordinary person without special distinction or characteristics
examples: The bloke at the pub told hilarious stories
He seems like a decent bloke despite his rough appearance
Just an average bloke trying to make a living
Local blokes gathered at the football match

definitions: fair or pale yellow color of hair
person having light-colored hair, especially a man
examples: His natural blond hair lightened in the summer sun
The child inherited blond hair from Scandinavian ancestors
The surfer was a typical California blond
Blond wood furniture brightened the dark room

definitions: woman or girl with fair or light-colored hair
pale yellowish color resembling fair hair
examples: The blonde actress became famous for dramatic roles
Natural blondes often have light-colored eyes as well
She chose a blonde shade for the bedroom walls
The blonde highlights added dimension to her hairstyle

definitions: event involving massive killing or slaughter of many people
situation resulting in severe financial losses or business failures
examples: The historic battle turned into a bloodbath for both armies
Witnesses described the scene as an absolute bloodbath
The stock market crash became a bloodbath for investors
Company layoffs created a corporate bloodbath

definitions: large dog breed with exceptional scent-tracking ability used in law enforcement
person who pursues something or someone with great determination and persistence
examples: Police bloodhounds tracked the escaped prisoner through the swamp
The bloodhound's keen nose can follow trails days old
The journalist was a bloodhound pursuing corruption stories
Like a bloodhound, the detective never gave up on cold cases

definitions: historical medical treatment involving deliberate blood removal to cure illness
elimination of personnel or resources often causing damage to an organization
examples: Medieval doctors believed bloodletting could cure many ailments
Leeches were commonly used for bloodletting procedures
The corporate bloodletting eliminated half the workforce
Political bloodletting weakened the party before elections

definitions: direct line of descent from an ancestor through generations
pedigree or genetic inheritance passed through family generations
examples: The royal bloodline traced back over a thousand years
DNA testing confirmed the family bloodline connections
Championship horses come from proven racing bloodlines
The kennel specialized in purebred bloodlines

definitions: killing or wounding of people typically during violent conflict
loss of life or injury resulting from war or violence
examples: The peace treaty aimed to prevent further bloodshed
Historians documented the bloodshed of ancient battles
Diplomatic negotiations sought to avoid unnecessary bloodshed
The revolution succeeded with minimal bloodshed

definitions: dark green chalcedony gemstone with red spots resembling blood drops
crystal believed to have healing properties in alternative medicine
examples: The jeweler set the bloodstone in a silver ring
Ancient warriors carried bloodstone for protection in battle
Crystal healers use bloodstone for grounding and courage
The bloodstone's unique pattern made each piece distinctive

definitions: flowing blood within the circulatory system of arteries, veins, and capillaries
system through which blood transports oxygen and nutrients throughout the body
examples: Medicine injected directly into the bloodstream acts quickly
Oxygen enters the bloodstream through the lungs
Infections can spread rapidly through the bloodstream
The bloodstream carries hormones to target organs

definitions: flower or mass of flowers on a plant at peak beauty
state of greatest health, beauty, or vigor in development
examples: Cherry trees burst into bloom every spring season
The garden's bloom attracted butterflies and bees
The artist was in full bloom during her thirties
Youth represents the bloom of human life

definitions: process of producing flowers or coming into flower
state of thriving or developing in a healthy vigorous way
examples: Spring triggers the blooming of countless wildflowers
The blooming roses filled the air with fragrance
The blooming economy created numerous job opportunities
Her blooming confidence transformed her entire demeanor

definitions: flower or cluster of flowers especially on fruit trees
period of development when someone or something begins to flourish
examples: Apple blossoms covered the orchard in white petals
The cherry blossom festival celebrates spring's arrival
Their friendship began to blossom over shared interests
The young dancer's talent started to blossom

definitions: process of flowers opening and developing on plants
period when abilities or relationships develop and flourish
examples: The blossoming fruit trees signaled spring's arrival
Photographers captured the blossoming of desert cacti
The blossoming romance surprised their friends and family
Her blossoming career in medicine showed great promise

definitions: spot or stain especially of ink or other liquid
shameful act or quality that damages reputation
examples: The ink blot ruined the important contract document
She used paper towels to absorb the coffee blot
The scandal was a blot on his political career
One blot on an otherwise perfect record
